page.title: 12WEST DRAYTON AND YIEWSLEY
page.content: The original Domesday Survey of 1086 shows that the parish of West Drayton had 17 land owners,which sugests a population of under 100.The total value of the Manor was Â£6.The name Drayton was originally spelt 'Draegtun'meaning a place where a boat could be draged over land.Yiewsley was originally known as 'Wiuesleg'meaning wives wood.The 1981 census figures show that the population of West Drayton ward was 6439 and that of Yiewsley was 6548.Over a thousand years ago the earliest settlement at West Drayton was probably stockaded to protect it from wild beasts living in the surrounding forest.Today there are no signs of that forest although because of its situation on the western limits of London there are wide variations of land use and population density.
